meanings.definition: A person who deceives or tricks others.
meanings.sent1: The cozeners pretended to be lost tourists to steal from unsuspecting people.
meanings.sent2: The cozeners in the movie were always one step ahead of the detectives.
meanings.sent3: The cozeners tried to sell a broken watch as a valuable antique, but no one fell for it.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the cozeners in the market, they will sweet-talk you into buying fake goods.
meanings.sent5: The cozeners wore disguises to blend in and swindle innocent bystanders.

meanings.sent1: She cozeners her friends by pretending to be sick to get out of chores.
meanings.sent2: The con artist cozeners people by promising them quick riches.
meanings.sent3: He cozeners his way into getting free samples at the store.
meanings.sent4: The magician cozeners the audience with his sleight of hand tricks.
meanings.sent5: The fox cozeners the rabbit into coming out of its burrow with false promises.
